title: Beyond the Genetics of Addiction
descriptions:
Title: Beyond the Genetics of Addiction

Abstract:

Addiction remains a complex and multifaceted disorder, with the interplay between genetic and environmental factors not yet fully understood. The proposed project, "Beyond the Genetics of Addiction," aims to unravel the contributions of genetic and environmental factors to addiction, focusing on nicotine, alcohol, cannabis, and caffeine. Leveraging the Netherlands Twin Register and a large sample size, this study will employ extended twin family designs, DNA-variant data, RNA data, and biomarkers analysis to identify and confirm genes and gene networks associated with addiction.

The objectives of this project are four-fold: (1) to disentangle the genetic and environmental factors contributing to addiction, (2) to identify and confirm genes and gene networks involved in addiction, (3) to explore gene expression patterns in relation to addiction, and (4) to investigate biomarkers and the relationship between substance use and health outcomes. By utilizing a longitudinal phenotype database and biological samples, this project will employ state-of-the-art analysis methods to shed new light on the complex etiology of addiction.

With over two decades of experience in data collection, coordination, and analysis, as well as expertise in behavior genetics and addiction research, our research team is well-equipped to tackle this ambitious project. Additional data collection will be conducted to supplement existing data sources, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of the genetic and environmental factors underlying addiction. This project has the potential to significantly advance our understanding of addiction and inform the development of effective prevention and treatment strategies.
